verse: अंसालम्बितवामकुण्डलधरं मन्दोन्नतभ्रूलतंकिञ्चित्कुञ्चितकोमलाधरपुटं साचिप्रसारेक्षणम्

word_by_word_meaning.लतंक: lata (a type of ornament for the forehead)

overall_meaning: This verse describes a person wearing earrings hanging from their left shoulders, with slightly raised eyebrows and tender lips, gazing gracefully with eyes.

verse: आलोलाङगुलिपल्लवैर्मुरलिकामापूरयन्तं मुदामूले कल्पतरोस्त्रिभङगललितं ध्यायेज्जगन्मोहनम्

word_by_word_meaning.ध्यायेज्जगन्मोहनम्: Meditate on the enchanting one who captivates the world

overall_meaning: This verse paints a scene of enchantment, with the sound of the flute filling the air, wish-fulfilling trees around, and an enchanting figure captivating the world.

verse: अक्षण्वतां फलमिदं न परं विदामःसख्यः पशूननु विवेशयतोर्वयस्यैः

word_by_word_meaning.विवेशयतोर्वयस्यैः: Entered along with the young ones

overall_meaning: This verse talks about a fruit that friends who follow animals with young ones know to be unmatched by any other for those with eyes.

verse: वक्‍त्रं व्रजेशसुतयोरनुवेणुजुष्‍टंयैर्वा निपीतमनुरक्तकटाक्षमोक्षम्‌

word_by_word_meaning.निपीतमनुरक्तकटाक्षमोक्षम्: The captivated glance of those in love

overall_meaning: This verse describes a face captivated either by the sound of Krishna's flute or by the loving glances of those captivated.

verse: अन्तःस्वभावभोक्ता ततोऽन्तरात्मा महामेघः ।खदिरश्चम्पक इव वा प्रवर्षणं किं विचारयति
overall_meaning: This verse reflects on the contemplation of the inner self, likening it to the experience of a great cloud like khadira and champaka flowers raining.

verse: अयि दीनदयार्द्र नाथ हे मथुरानाथ कदावलोक्यसे ।हृदयं त्वदलोककातरं दयित भ्राम्यति किं करोम्यहम्
overall_meaning: Oh pitiable and compassionate Lord of Mathura, when I see your moist look, my anxious heart wanders, what shall I do, my beloved?

verse: अयि नन्दतनूज किङ्करं पतितं मां विषमे भवाम्बुधौ ।कृपया तव पादपङकजस्थितधूलीसदृशं विचिन्तय
overall_meaning: Oh Nanda's son, fallen servant, in distress I become like an ocean. By your grace, I meditate on the dust of your lotus feet.

verse: अलमलमलमेका प्राणिनां पातकानांनिरसनविषये वा कृष्णकृष्णेति वाणी ।यदि भवति मुकुन्दे भक्तिरानन्दसान्द्राकरतलकलिता सा मोक्षसाम्राज्यलक्ष्मीः

word_by_word_meaning.भक्तिरानन्दसान्द्राकरतलकलिता: formed by the blissful waves of devotion
word_by_word_meaning.मोक्षसाम्राज्यलक्ष्मीः: the fortune of the kingdom of liberation

overall_meaning: Enough of impurities, removal of sins for living beings, or speech 'Krishna Krishna'. If it becomes for Mukunda, formed by the blissful waves of devotion, that is the fortune of the kingdom of liberation.

verse: अहङकार क्वापि व्रज वृजिन हे मा त्वमिह भू-रभूमिर्दर्पाणामहमपसर त्वं पिशुन हे ।अये क्रोध स्थानान्तरमनुसरानन्यमनसांत्रिलोकीनाथो नो हृदि वसतु देवो हरिरसौ
overall_meaning: Ego, go away from anywhere, O friend. O earth, pride not in me, spread not, O envious one. O anger, stay not in the place inside, control other minds, Lord of the three worlds, may Hari reside in our hearts.

verse: आनीता नटवन्मया तव पुरः श्रीकृष्ण या भूमिकाव्योमाकाशखखाम्बराब्धिवसवस्त्वत्प्रीतयेऽद्यावधि ।प्रीतो यद्यसि ताः समीक्ष्य भगवन् तद् वाञ्छितं देहि मेनो चेद् ब्रूहि कदापि मानय पुनर्मामीदृशीं भूमिकाम्
overall_meaning: Brought by the dramatic illusion in front of you, O Lord Krishna, the role which resides in the sky like a garment in the ocean, for your pleasure now, if pleased, O Lord, grant that desired role, tell my mind, if at any time, respect me again in this role.

verse: आश्रितमात्रं पुरुषं स्वाभिमुखं कर्षति श्रीशः ।लोहमपि चुम्बकाश्मा संमुखमात्रं जडं यद्वत्
overall_meaning: Lord Vishnu attracts a person who is solely dependent and turned towards Him, just like a magnet attracts even iron but remains inert when placed in front only, like a stone.

verse: आहुश्च ते नलिननाभ पदारविन्दंयोगेश्वरैर्हृदि विचिन्त्यमगाधबोधैः ।संसारकूपपतितोत्तरणावलम्बंगेहंजुषामपि मनस्युदियात्सदा नः

word_by_word_meaning.संसारकूपपतितोत्तरणावलम्बं: the support for crossing the ocean of worldly existence
word_by_word_meaning.गेहंजुषामपि: even for those in household life

overall_meaning: Your lotus-navelled feet, O Lord of Yoga, are contemplated in the heart by those with profound understanding. May it always enter the minds of even those in household life, say the lords of yoga, as the support for crossing the ocean of worldly existence, for us.

verse: इदानीमङगमक्षालि रचितं चानुलेपनम्‌ ।इदानीमेव ते कृष्ण धूलीधूसरितं वपुः
overall_meaning: Now composed of bathing the body and anointment, even now, O Krishna, your body is dusted by dust.

verse: इन्दीवरदलश्याममिन्दिरानन्दकन्दलम्वन्दारुजनमन्दारं वन्देऽहं यदुनन्दनम्
overall_meaning: I bow to the dark lotus petals, the source of joy to Indira (Lakshmi), like a bunch of clouds from the forest, I bow to the delighter of the Yadus (Krishna).

verse: इन्दुं कैरविणीव कोकपटलीवाम्भोजिनीवल्लभंमेघं चातकमण्डलीव मधुपश्रेणीव पुष्पव्रजम् ।माकन्दं पिकसुन्दरीव रमणीवात्मेश्वरं प्रोषितंचेतोवृत्तिरियं सदा प्रियवर त्वां द्रष्टुमुत्कण्ठते

word_by_word_meaning.रमणीवात्मेश्वरं: like the beloved of the soul

overall_meaning: Forever, the heart's yearning to see you, O beloved, is like seeing the moon like a cloud, beloved like a lotus, like a cloud and a canopy, like a Chataka bird, like a swarm of bees, like a mass of flowers, like a musk deer, like a beautiful cuckoo, like the beloved of the soul.

verse: इमां घनश्रेणिमिवोन्मुखः शिखीचकोरकः कार्तिकचन्द्रिकामिव ।रथाङगनामा तरणेरिव त्विष कृष्णच्छविं वीक्ष्य न कः प्रमोदते
overall_meaning: Who does not delight in quickly seeing Krishna, who appears like a peacock facing a dense cloud, like the Kartika moon, with chariot's wheels, like a boat?

verse: उपासतामात्मविदः पुराणं परं पुमांसं निहितं गुहायाम् ।वयं यशोदाशिशुबाललीलाकथासुधासिन्धुषु लीलयामः

word_by_word_meaning.यशोदाशिशुबाललीलाकथासुधासिन्धुषु: in the ocean of stories of Yashoda's child Krishna's playful acts

overall_meaning: We sport in the ocean of stories of Yashoda's child Krishna's playful acts, stored in the cave of ancient, supreme narrative for those who worship, knowers of the self.

verse: एकं शास्त्रं देवकीपुत्रगीतमेको देवो देवकीपुत्र एव ।एको मन्त्रस्तस्य नामानि यानि कर्माप्येकंतस्य देवस्य सेवा

word_by_word_meaning.देवकीपुत्रगीतम्: song of the son of Devaki

overall_meaning: One scripture, the song of the son of Devaki, One God, indeed the son of Devaki, One mantra, His names, His actions, also the service of the devoted to the God.

verse: एवं कुर्वति भक्तिं कृष्णकथानुग्रहोत्पन्ना ।समुदेति सूक्ष्मभक्तिर्यस्या हरिरन्तराविशति

word_by_word_meaning.कृष्णकथानुग्रहोत्पन्ना: born from the grace of Krishna's stories

overall_meaning: Thus does devotion arise, born from the grace of Krishna's stories, subtle devotion, within whom Lord Hari enters.

verse: कनककमलमालः केशिकंसादिकालःसमरभुवि करालः प्रेमबापीमरालः ।निखिलभुवनपालः पुण्यवल्लीप्रवालोवसतु हृदि मदीये सैव गोपालबाल

word_by_word_meaning.प्रेमबापीमरालः: drenched in the love of devotees
word_by_word_meaning.पुण्यवल्लीप्रवालोवसतु: adorned with the garland of virtues

overall_meaning: The young cowherd, adorned with a golden lotus garland, locks of hair, and others, fierce in the battlefield, drenched in the love of devotees, ruler of the entire world, adorned with the garland of virtues, resides in my heart.

verse: कनकरुचिदुकूलश्चारुबर्हावचूलःसकलनिगमसारः कोऽपि लीलावतारः ।त्रिभुवनसुखकारी शैलधारी मुरारिःपरिकलितरथाङगो मङगलं नस्तनोतु

word_by_word_meaning.त्रिभुवनसुखकारी: bestower of happiness to the three worlds

overall_meaning: Someone adorned with a golden cloth, beautiful Brahmanical marks, essence of all scriptures, a playful incarnation, bestower of happiness to the three worlds, holding the mountain, enemy of Mura, surrounded by the chariot's wheels, auspicious, may protect.

verse: कन्दर्पकोटिसुभगं वाञ्छितफलदं दयार्णवं कृष्णम् ।त्यक्‍त्वा कमन्यविषयं नेत्रयुगं द्रष्‍टुमुत्सहते

word_by_word_meaning.कन्दर्पकोटिसुभगं: most charming like millions of Cupids

overall_meaning: To Krishna, who is most charming like millions of Cupids, bestower of desired fruits, an ocean of compassion, leaving aside the object of desires, unable to see with eyes.

verse: कामं सन्तु सहस्त्रशः कतिपये सारस्य धौरेयकाःकामं वा कमनीयतापरिणतिस्वाराज्यबद्धव्रताः ।नैवैतैर्विवदामहे न च वयं देव प्रियं ब्रूमहेयत्सत्यं रमणीयतापरिणतिस्त्वय्येव पारं गता

word_by_word_meaning.धौरेयकाः: bound by the vow of the charioteer
word_by_word_meaning.कमनीयतापरिणतिस्वाराज्यबद्धव्रताः: the vow binding the kingdom of charming realization of desires
word_by_word_meaning.नैवैतैर्विवदामहे: we do not argue with these

overall_meaning: May desires be fulfilled by thousands or some, essence of devotion, bound by the vow of the charioteer, desire or the vow binding the kingdom of charming

verse: कालिन्दीपुलिने तमालनिविडच्छाये पुरः सञ्चर-त्तोये तोयजपत्रपात्रनिहितं दध्यन्नमश्‍नाति यः ।वामे पाणितले निधाय मधुरं वेणुं विषाणं कटि-प्रान्ते गाश्च विलोकयन् प्रतिपलं तं बालमालोकये

word_by_word_meaning.कालिन्दीपुलिने: on the banks of the Yamuna
word_by_word_meaning.तमालनिविडच्छाये: in the shade of tamala trees
word_by_word_meaning.तोयजपत्रपात्रनिहितं: placed in water pots made of leaves
word_by_word_meaning.पाणितले: in the palm of his hand

overall_meaning: I gaze upon the boy placed in water pots made of leaves, in the shade of tamala trees on the banks of the Yamuna, in front of moving water, who eats curd, and sweetly plays the flute in his left hand, and the cows look at him at the waist, every moment.

verse: किं करोमि क्व गच्छामि कं वा शरणमाश्रये ।विमुखे त्वयि गोविन्द हा हा पापी हतो हतः
overall_meaning: Alas! Alas! O Govinda! What should I do? Where should I go? Whom should I take refuge in? Helpless and killed, I, a sinner, am turned away from you.

verse: किं पिबन्ति मम पदरसं मुनयः सुधां विहाय ।ज्ञातुमिदं बालो हरिः स्वपदं मुखे निनाय
overall_meaning: What do the sages drink, leaving aside the nectar of my feet? The boy Krishna brings to his mouth the nectar of his own abode, to know this.

verse: कृपापात्रं यस्य त्रिपुररिपुरम्भोजवसतिःसुता जह्नोः पूता चरणनखनिर्णेजनजलम् ।प्रदानं वा यस्य त्रिभुवनपतित्वं विभुरपिनिदानं सोऽस्माकं जयति कुलदेवो यदुपतिः

words.त्रिपुररिपु: the enemy of Tripura (a demon, referring to Lord Shiva)
words.रम्भोजवसतिः: living in the lotus, the one who resides in a lotus
words.जह्नोः: of Jahnu (another name for the Ganges)
words.चरणनखनिर्णेजनजलम्: the water from washing the feet

overall_meaning: The verse praises Lord Krishna, the family deity, and the Lord of the Yadus. It describes Him as the recipient of mercy, whose feet were washed by the purified water of the Ganges, the daughter of Jahnu. Despite being powerful and the lord of the three worlds, He is the cause and the ultimate source of everything. Thus, He triumphs and is victorious.

verse: कृष्ण कृष्णेति कृष्णेति यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः ।जलं भित्त्वा यथा पद्यं नरकादुद्धराम्यहम्
overall_meaning: This verse expresses the power of remembering and chanting the name of Krishna. It conveys that whoever constantly remembers and chants "Krishna, Krishna," will be uplifted by Krishna Himself from hell, just as a lotus emerges through the water.

verse: कृष्ण त्वं पठ किं पठामि ननु रे शास्त्रं किमु ज्ञायतेतत्त्वं कस्य विभोः स कस्त्रिभुवनाधीशश्च तेनापि किम् ।ज्ञानं भक्तिरथो विरक्तिरनया किं मुक्तिरेवास्तु
overall_meaning: In this verse, the speaker addresses Krishna, expressing a philosophical inquiry. It questions the significance of studying scriptures and the understanding of the essence of the Almighty. The speaker contemplates the nature of true knowledge, devotion, and detachment, ultimately pondering if these lead to liberation, suggesting that liberation itself should be the ultimate goal.

verse: कृष्ण त्वदीयपदपङकजपञ्जरान्तेअद्यैव मे विशतु मानसराजहंसः ।प्राणप्रयाणसमये कफवातपित्तैःकण्ठावरोधनविधौ स्मरणं कुतस्ते

words.प्राणप्रयाणसमये: at the time of departure of life
words.कफवातपित्तैः: by phlegm, wind, and bile (bodily humors)
words.कण्ठावरोधनविधौ: in the condition of throat obstruction

overall_meaning: The verse expresses a plea to Lord Krishna for the mind, likened to a royal swan, to enter and dwell within the cage of His lotus feet today itself. It conveys the concern that at the time of death, when the bodily humors cause the throat to choke, how will one be able to remember Him?

verse: कृष्णकथासंश्रवणे महोत्सवः सत्यवादश्च ।परयुवतौ द्रविणे वा परापवादे पराङ्‌मुखता
overall_meaning: This verse highlights the qualities and behavior of a true devotee. Such a devotee finds great joy in hearing stories about Krishna, always speaks the truth, remains indifferent to other women and wealth, and avoids slandering others.

verse: केनापि गीयमाने हरिगीते वेणुनादे वा ।आनन्दाविर्भावो युगपत्स्याद्‌धृष्टसात्त्विकोद्रेकः

words.वेणुनादे: in the sound of the flute

overall_meaning: This verse describes the intense and simultaneous manifestation of bliss and the bold surge of sattvic (pure and good) emotions in a person when they hear someone singing the songs of Hari (Krishna) or the sound of the flute.

verse: क्वाननं क्व नयनं क्व नासिका क्व श्रुतिः क च शिखेति केलितः ।तत्र तत्र निहिताङगुलीदलो वल्लवीकुलमनन्दयत्प्रभुः
overall_meaning: This verse describes Krishna playfully delighting the gopis by placing His fingers on various parts of their faces and bodies, like the face, eyes, nose, ears, and tuft of hair, asking 'where is this?' and bringing joy to the group of gopis.

verse: क्वायं क्षुद्रमतिर्दासः क्व स्वामी गुणवारिधिः ।मुहुर्मुहुर्निमग्नं मां क्षमस्व करुणानिधे
overall_meaning: The verse contrasts the petty-minded servant (the speaker) with the master, who is an ocean of virtues. The speaker repeatedly asks for forgiveness from the compassionate Lord, acknowledging their own faults and seeking mercy.

verse: क्षीरसारमपहृत्य शङकया स्वीकृतं यदि पलायनं त्वया ।मानसे मम घनान्धतामसे नन्दनन्दन कथं न लीयसे
overall_meaning: This verse addresses Krishna as the son of Nanda. It poetically questions why Krishna, who stealthily steals butter, does not similarly dispel the dense darkness of the speaker's mind. The speaker wonders how Krishna can leave them in such darkness without merging into their mind and removing it.

verse: गुञ्जारवालिकलितं गुञ्जापुञ्जान्विते शिरसि ।भुञ्जानं सह गोपैः कुञ्जान्तरवर्तिनं हरिं स्मरत

words.कुञ्जान्तरवर्तिनं: dwelling in the midst of groves

overall_meaning: This verse evokes the image of Krishna, adorned with a string of gunja berries on His head, enjoying in the company of the cowherd boys within the groves. It calls upon the devotee to remember and meditate upon such a vision of Hari (Krishna).

verse: गोपबालसुन्दरीगणावृतं कलानिधिंरासमण्डलीविहारकारिकामसुन्दरम् ।पद्मयोनिशङकरादिदेववृन्दवन्दितंनीलवारिवाहकान्तिगोकुलेशमाश्रये
overall_meaning: This verse praises Krishna as the Lord of Gokula, surrounded by the beautiful cowherd girls, a repository of all arts, and the centerpiece of the Rasa dance circle. He is beautiful in all actions, worshipped by Brahma, Shiva, and other gods, and has the radiance of a dark rain cloud. The devotee declares their refuge in Krishna.

verse: गोपाल इति मत्वा त्वां प्रचुरक्षीरवाञ्छया ।श्रितो मातुः स्तनक्षीरमपि लब्धुं न शक्रुयाम्
overall_meaning: This verse reflects on the devotee's longing and dependence on Krishna. The devotee, thinking of Krishna as a cowherd and desiring abundant milk, resorts to the mother's breast but laments that even then, they were not able to obtain the milk. It symbolizes the devotee's yearning for Krishna's love and sustenance.

verse: गोविन्द द्वारिकावासिन्‌ कृष्ण गोपीजनप्रिय ।कौरवैः परिभूतां मां किं न जानासि केशव
overall_meaning: The verse is a plea to Krishna, addressing Him with various epithets like Govinda, dweller of Dwarka, beloved of the gopis, and Keshava. The speaker, feeling insulted by the Kauravas, asks Krishna why He does not know about their plight.

verse: गोविन्दं गोकुलानन्दं गोपालं गोपवल्लभम् ।गोवर्द्धनधरं धीरं तं वन्दे गोमतीप्रियम्
overall_meaning: This verse praises Krishna with various attributes. It describes Him as Govinda, the joy of Gokula, protector of cows, beloved of the gopis, the holder of Govardhana, and steadfast. The speaker bows to Him, who is also beloved of the Gomati river.

verse: गोविन्दं गोकुलानन्दं वेणुवादनतत्परम् ।राधिकारञ्जनं श्यामं वन्दे गोपालनन्दनम्
overall_meaning: This verse praises Krishna with various attributes. It describes Him as Govinda, the joy of Gokula, engaged in playing the flute, the delight of Radha, and dark-complexioned. The speaker bows to Krishna, the son of the cowherd Nanda.

verse: ग्राम्यकथासूद्वेगः सुतीर्थगमनेषु तात्पर्यम् ।यदुपतिकथावियोगे व्यर्थं गतमायुरिति चिन्ता
overall_meaning: This verse reflects the thoughts of a devotee who finds worldly talk distasteful and is eager to visit holy places. The devotee is worried that their life is wasted in the absence of stories and discourse about Krishna, the lord of the Yadus.

verse: चर्वयत्‍यनिशं मर्म मम मायानिशाचरी ।क्वासि हे पूतनाघातिन् मायाकुहकनाशक
overall_meaning: This verse is a plea to Krishna, the slayer of the demoness Putana and the destroyer of illusion and trickery. The devotee laments that their heart is constantly being tormented by the demoness of illusion and asks Krishna where He is.

verse: चिकुरं बहुलं विरलभ्रमरं मृदुलं वचनं विपुलं नयनम् ।अधरं मधुरं ललितं वदनं चपलं चरितं च कदानुभवे
overall_meaning: This verse is a description of Krishna's physical beauty and charm. The devotee longs to experience Krishna's thick hair adorned with scattered bees, soft speech, large eyes, sweet lips, charming face, and playful actions, and wonders when they will be able to have this divine experience.

verse: चूडाचुम्बितचारुचन्द्रकचमत्कारव्रजभ्राजितंदिव्यं मञ्जुमरन्दपङकजमुखभ्रूनृत्यदिन्दीवरम् ।रज्यद्वेणुकमूलरोकविलसद्विम्बाधरौष्ठं मुहुःश्रीवृन्दावनकुञ्जकेलिललितं राधाप्रियं प्रीणये
overall_meaning: This verse praises Krishna, describing His beautiful, moon-like face kissed by the crest, adorned with the astonishment of Vraja, and His divine, sweet face like a lotus, with eyebrows dancing like blue lotuses. His flute playing shines brightly, and His lips are like Bimba fruit, always shining. The verse concludes with a prayer to the beloved of Radha, who playfully sports in the groves of Sri Vrindavan, to bring joy.

verse: चेतश्चञ्चलतां विहाय पुरतः संधाय कोटिद्वयंतत्रैकत्र निधेहि सर्वविषयानन्यत्र च श्रीपतिम् ।विश्रान्तिर्हितमप्यहो क्व नु तयोर्मध्ये तदालोच्यतांयुक्‍त्या वानुभवेन यत्र परमानन्दश्च तत्सेव्यताम
overall_meaning: This verse advises the mind to abandon its restlessness and fix itself firmly on two axes: all objects on one side and the Lord of Lakshmi (Krishna) on the other. It suggests considering, through reasoning or experience, where true rest and supreme bliss lie and to serve that source.

verse: जन्तुषु भगवद्भावं भगवति भूतानि पश्यति क्रमशः ।एतादृशी दशा चेत्तदैव हरिदासवर्यः स्यात्
overall_meaning: This verse states that if one gradually sees the divine nature of the Lord in all living beings, and perceives all creatures as manifestations of the Lord, such a person can truly be considered the greatest devotee of Hari (Krishna).

verse: जिह्वे कीर्तय केशवं मुररिपुं चेतो भज श्रीधरंपाणिद्वन्द्वसमर्चयाच्युतकथां श्रोत्रद्वयं त्वं श्रृणु ।कृष्णं लोकय लोचनद्वय हरेर्गच्छाङि‍घ्रयुग्मालयंजिघ्र घ्राण मुकुन्दपादतुलसीं मूर्द्धन्नमाधोक्षजम्
overall_meaning: This verse is an invocation to the senses and mind to engage in the worship of Krishna. The tongue is urged to praise Keshava, the mind to worship Shri Krishna, the hands to worship Acyuta, the ears to listen to His stories, the eyes to see Krishna, the feet to go to His abode, the nose to smell the Tulasi leaves at Mukunda's feet, and the head to bow to Adhokshaja.

verse: जीर्णा तरिः सरिदियं च गभीरनीरानक्राकुला वहति वायुरतिप्रचण्डः ।तार्याः स्त्रियश्च शिशवश्च तथैव वृद्धाःतत्कर्णधारभुजयोर्बलमाश्रयामः
overall_meaning: This verse metaphorically describes life as a worn-out boat navigating a deep, crocodile-infested river with fierce winds. It emphasizes the need for the strength of the helmsman's arms (Krishna's guidance) to safely cross the treacherous journey of life, especially for women, children, and the elderly.

verse: जीर्णा तरी सरिति नीरगभीरधाराबाला वयं सकलमित्थमनर्थहेतुः ।विश्वासबीजमिदमेव कृशोदरीणांयन्माधवस्त्वमसि सम्प्रति कर्णधारः
overall_meaning: This verse continues the metaphor of the boat and river, describing the boat as worn out, navigating deep currents, and the passengers (us) as children. It suggests that all troubles can be attributed to this condition. However, the only seed of trust for the fragile (thin-waisted ones) is that Krishna (Madhava) is now the helmsman, guiding them through life's difficulties.

verse: तटी प्रस्फुटीनीपवाटीकुटीरे वधूटीनटीदृक्पुटीपीयमानम् ।समालिप्तपाटीरवक्षस्तटीकं हरिद्राभराजत्पटीकं नमामि
overall_meaning: I bow to Krishna, whose chest is adorned with shining waves on the shore, whose bride-like eyes are drinking the beauty of the shining waves, and whose chest is adorned with garments adorned with yellow turmeric and silver.

verse: तत् कैशोरं तच्च वक्‍त्रारविन्दं तत्कारुण्यं ते च लीलाकटाक्षाः ।तत्सौन्दर्यं सा च मन्दस्मित श्रीः सत्यं सत्यं दुर्लभं दैवतेषु
overall_meaning: That youthfulness, lotus-like face, compassion, your playful glances, beauty, and gentle smile, O Lakshmi, are truly rare among the gods.

verse: तत्प्रेमभावरसभक्तिविलासना महारेषु चेत् खलु मनः किमु कामिनीभिः ।तल्लोकनाथपदपङ्कजधूलिमिश्र लिप्‍तं वपुः किमु वृथागुरुचन्दनाद्यैः

words.तत्प्रेमभावरसभक्तिविलासना: affectionate play of love and devotion
words.तल्लोकनाथपदपङ्कजधूलिमिश्र: mixed with the dust of the lotus feet of the Lord of the universe
words.वृथागुरुचन्दनाद्यैः: with the sandalwood and other substances

overall_meaning: If the mind indeed experiences the affectionate play of love and devotion like great sages, what to say about the smudged body mixed with the dust of the lotus feet of the Lord of the universe, or with sandalwood and other substances.

verse: तद्वद्रजतां पुंसां दृग्वाङ्‌मनसामगोचरोऽपि हरिः ।कृपया फलत्यकस्मात्सत्यानन्दामृतेन विपुलेन

words.दृग्वाङ्‌मनसामगोचर: perceivable by sight, speech, and mind
words.सत्यानन्दामृतेन: by the nectar of true bliss

overall_meaning: Just as Hari, although perceptible by sight, speech, and mind, is like silver to the deserving souls, He generously bears fruits unasked by the abundant nectar of true bliss.

verse: तमसि रविरिवोद्यन्मज्जतामम्बुराशौप्लव इव तृषितानां स्वादुवर्षीव मेघः ।निधिरिव निधनानां दीर्घतीव्रामयानांभिषगिव कुशलं मे दातुमायाति शौरिः
overall_meaning: Just as the sun rises in the darkness, or the clouds pour like a sweet shower in the rainy season, or a treasure comes to the dying like a physician to the severely ill, similarly the brave one grants me well-being.

verse: तस्मिन्ननुभवति मनः प्रगृह्यमाणं परात्मसुखम् ।स्थिरतां याते तस्मिन् याति मदोन्मत्तदन्तिदशाम्

words.मदोन्मत्तदन्तिदशाम्: the intoxicated state of the intoxicated ones

overall_meaning: In that, the mind experiences the embracing of supreme bliss, attains steadiness, and enters the intoxicated state of the intoxicated ones.

verse: तावद्रागादयः स्तेनास्तावत्कारागृहं गृहम्‌ ।तावन्मोहोऽङ्‌घ्रिनिगडो यावत्कृष्ण न ते जनाः
overall_meaning: Until then, the attachments and thieves are your house, until then, delusion is in the heel, until then, people are not yours, Krishna.

verse: तिष्ठन्तं घननीलं स्वतेजसा भासयन्तमिह विश्‍वम् ।पीताम्बरपरिधानं चन्दनकर्पूरलिप्तसर्वाङगम्

words.चन्दनकर्पूरलिप्तसर्वाङगम्: anointed with sandalwood and camphor on all limbs

overall_meaning: Standing and illuminating the universe here with its own radiance, wearing dark blue attire, and anointed with sandalwood and camphor on all limbs.

verse: ते ते भावाः सकलजगतीलोभनीयप्रभावानानातृष्णासुहृदि हृदि मे काममाविर्भवन्तु ।वीणावेणुक्कणितलसितस्मरेवक्‍त्रारविन्दा-न्नाहं जाने मधुरमपरं नन्दपुण्याम्बुपूरात्

words.सकलजगतीलोभनीयप्रभावानाना: with alluring influences on the whole world
words.सुहृदि: in the heart of my friend
words.वीणावेणुक्कणितलसितस्मरेवक्‍त्रारविन्दा-न: I know not the sweetness greater than the waves of the veena and flute playing of Krishna
words.नन्दपुण्याम्बुपूरात्: than the holy water of the Nanda

overall_meaning: May those states, with alluring influences on the whole world, arise desires in the heart of my friend, in my heart, I know not sweeter than sweet, the waves of the veena and flute playing of Krishna, sweeter than the holy water of the Nanda.

verse: त्रिभुवनसरसाभ्यां दीप्तभूषापराभ्यांदृशि दृशि शिशिराभ्यां दिव्यलीलाकुलाभ्याम् ।अशरणशरणाभ्यामद्भुताभ्यां पदाभ्या-मयमयमनुकूजद्वेणुरायाति देवः

words.त्रिभुवनसरसाभ्यां: with the rivers of the three worlds

overall_meaning: With the rivers of the three worlds, seen with splendid ornaments, seen by the wintry winds, and adorned with divine playfulness, to those who seek refuge, the divine, with extraordinary feet, this enchanting flute plays.

verse: त्वं पापितारकः कृष्ण भवसागरनाविकः ।त्राहि मां भवभीमाब्धेस्तवैव शरणागतम्

words.भवसागरनाविकः: the boatman across the ocean of existence
words.भवभीमाब्धेस्तवैव: from the dreadful ocean of existence, Yours alone

overall_meaning: You, Krishna, the savior from sin, the boatman across the ocean of existence, please save me from the dreadful ocean of existence, Yours alone, who has taken refuge.

verse: देवकीतनयपूजनपूतः पूतनारिचरणोदकधूतः ।यद्यहं स्मृतधनञ्जयसूतः किं करिष्यति स मे यमदूत

words.पूतनारिचरणोदकधूतः: cleansed by the water that washed the feet of Putana's killer
words.यमदूत: the messengers of Yama (the god of death)

overall_meaning: Worshiped by Devaki's son, cleansed by the water that washed the feet of Putana's killer, if I, the son of Kunti (Arjuna), remember, what will he do to me, the messengers of Yama (the god of death)?

verse: दोर्भ्यां दोर्भ्यां व्रजन्तं व्रजसदनजनाह्वानतः प्रोल्लसन्तंमन्दं मन्दं हसन्तं मधुमधुरवचो मेति मेति ब्रुवन्तम् ।गोपालीपाणितालीतरलितवलयध्वानमुग्धान्तरालंवन्दे तं देवमिन्दीवरविमलदलश्यामलं नन्दबालम्

words.व्रजसदनजनाह्वानतः: called by the people in the houses of Vraja
words.गोपालीपाणितालीतरलितवलयध्वानमुग्धान्तरालं: swaying with the bangles on the hands of Gopalis
words.देवमिन्दीवरविमलदलश्यामलं: the divine, who is dark like the fresh blue lotus

overall_meaning: With both hands, moving and called by the people in the houses of Vraja, smiling, slowly, smiling, with sweet words, saying 'come', speaking, swaying with the bangles on the hands of Gopalis, I worship Him, the divine, who is dark like the fresh blue lotus, the child of Nanda.

verse: दौर्भाग्यमिन्द्रियाणां कृष्णे विषये हि शाश्वतिके ।क्षणिकेषु पापकरणेष्वपि सज्जन्ते यदन्यविषयेषु

words.यदन्यविषयेषु: in the sense objects other than Krishna

overall_meaning: Of the unfortunate senses, in Krishna, indeed, in the sense objects, lasting, momentary, even evil deeds take place in the sense objects other than Krishna.

verse: न जाने सम्मुखायाते प्रियाणि वदति प्रिये ।प्रयान्ति मम गात्राणि श्रोत्रतां किमु नेत्रताम्
overall_meaning: I do not know, in the presence of beloved ones, to the beloved, what speaks, my limbs go, hearing, what about the sight?

verse: न प्रेमगन्धोऽस्ति दरोऽपि मे हरौक्रन्दामि सौभाग्यभरं प्रकाशितुम् ।वंशीविलास्याननलोकनं विनाबिभर्मि यत्प्राणपतङगकान् वृथा

words.प्रेमगन्धोऽस्ति: there is no fragrance of love
words.वंशीविलास्याननलोकनं: I see the playfulness of the flute
words.प्राणपतङगकान्: the bees, the masters of life

overall_meaning: There is no fragrance of love even in the tree, yet I cry for Hari (Krishna), filled with fortune, to reveal. I see the playfulness of the flute, without which I support the bees, the masters of life, in vain.

verse: नखनियमितकण्डून् पाण्डवस्यन्दनाश्वा-ननुदिनमभिषिञ्चन्नञ्जलिस्थैः पयोभिः ।अवतु विततगात्रस्तोत्रसंस्यूतमौलि-र्दशनविधृतरश्मिर्देवकी पुण्यराशिः

words.न्दनाश्वा-ननुदिनम: every day, the horses of the chariot
words.विततगात्रस्तोत्रसंस्यूतमौलि-र्दशनविधृतरश: the broad-shouldered one, wearing the garland of hymns, and the one holding the wheel and the club

overall_meaning: With claws and teeth under control, every day, the horses of the chariot of Pandava, bathing with folded hands, with water, may they protect the broad-shouldered one, wearing the garland of hymns, and the one holding the wheel and the club, Devaki, the repository of virtue.

verse: नन्दनन्दनपदारविन्दयोर्मन्दमन्दमनुजायतां मनः ।मुञ्च मुञ्च विषयेषु वासनाः किञ्च किञ्च तदुदीर्यतां वचः

words.नन्दनन्दनपदारविन्दयोर्मन्दमन्दमनुजायतां: may the mind dwell gently and repeatedly on the lotus feet of Nandanandana (Krishna)

overall_meaning: May the mind dwell gently and repeatedly on the lotus feet of Nandanandana (Krishna), let go, let go from the sense objects, the desires, a little, a little, may they gradually diminish, speech.

verse: नमः श्रीद्वारकेशाय गाश्च चारयते नमः ।राजराजेश्वरायाथ पार्थसारथये नमः
overall_meaning: Salutations to the Lord of Dwarka, who tends cows, and to the king of kings, and to the charioteer of Partha (Arjuna).

verse: नमस्तस्मै परेशाय कृष्णायाद्भुतकर्मणे ।धूलिधूसरिताङगाय नमस्तैजसमूर्तये

words.धूलिधूसरिताङगाय: whose body is covered with dust
words.नमस्तैजसमूर्तये: salutations to the embodiment of effulgence

overall_meaning: Salutations to that Supreme Lord Krishna, of wondrous deeds, whose body is covered with dust, salutations to the embodiment of effulgence.

verse: नमोऽस्तु भीष्मभीष्माय प्रह्लादाह्लादकाय च ।परःसहस्त्रपत्नीभिः सेविताय जितात्मने

words.प्रह्लादाह्लादकाय: to the source of joy for Prahlada

overall_meaning: Salutations to Bhishma, to the source of joy for Prahlada, and to the conqueror of the self, served by thousands of superior wives.

verse: नवनीरदसुन्दरनीलवपुंशितिकण्ठशिखण्डितभालशुभम् ।कमलाञ्चितखञ्जननेत्रयुगं तुलसीदलदामसुगन्धवपुम् ।जगदादिगुरुं व्रजराजसुतं प्रणमामि निरन्तरश्रीरमणम्

words.नवनीरदसुन्दरनीलवपुं: with a beautiful dark blue complexion like a fresh rain cloud
words.शितिकण्ठशिखण्डितभालशुभम्: with a peacock feather adorning his head
words.कमलाञ्चितखञ्जननेत्रयुगं: with eyes like lotus petals and wagtail birds
words.तुलसीदलदामसुगन्धवपुम्: whose body is fragrant with garlands of tulsi leaves
words.जगदादिगुरुं: the original teacher of the world
words.व्रजराजसुतं: the son of the king of Vraja
words.निरन्तरश्रीरमणम्: to the eternal consort of Lakshmi

overall_meaning: I bow down to the son of the king of Vraja, the original teacher of the world, whose beautiful dark blue complexion is like a fresh rain cloud, adorned with a peacock feather on his head, eyes like lotus petals and wagtail birds, whose body is fragrant with garlands of tulsi leaves, and who is the eternal consort of Lakshmi.

verse: नवनीलमेघरुचिरः परः पुमानवनीमवाप्य धृतगोपविग्रहः ।महनीयकीर्तिरमरैरपि स्वयं नवनीतभिक्षुरधुना स चिन्त्यते

words.नवनीलमेघरुचिरः: having the luster of a fresh dark blue rain cloud
words.धृतगोपविग्रहः: assuming the form of a cowherd

overall_meaning: Having the luster of a fresh dark blue rain cloud, the supreme man, having descended to earth, assuming the form of a cowherd, with great fame, even contemplated by the gods, the butter thief is now thought of.

verse: युगायितं निमेषेण चक्षुषा प्रावृषायितम् ।शून्यायितं जगत्सर्वं गोविन्दविरहेण मे
overall_meaning: A moment seems like ages, and my eyes feel like the rainy season. The entire world appears empty to me in separation from Govinda.

verse: नाहं विप्रो न च नरपतिर्नापि वैश्यो न शूदोनाहं वर्णी न च गृहपतिर्नो वनस्थो यतिर्वा ।किन्तु प्रोद्यन्निखिलपरमान्दपूर्णामृताब्धे -र्गोपीभर्तुः पदकमलयोर्दासदासानुदासः

words.निखिलपरमानन्दपूर्णामृताब्धेः: from the ocean of supreme bliss
words.गोपीभर्तुः: of the lord of the Gopis
words.दासदासानुदासः: the servant of the servant of the servants

overall_meaning: I am not a Brahmin, nor a king, nor a merchant, nor a laborer. I do not belong to any class, nor am I a householder, a forest-dweller, or an ascetic. But I am the servant of the servant of the servants of the lord of the Gopis, who rises from the ocean of supreme bliss.

verse: निखिलभुवनलक्ष्मीनित्यलीलास्पदाभ्यांकमलविपिनवीथीगर्वसर्वंकषाभ्याम् ।प्रणमदभयदानप्रौढिगाढोद्धताभ्यांकिमपि वहतु चेतः कृष्णपादाम्बुजाभ्याम्

words.कमलविपिनवीथीगर्वसर्वंकषाभ्याम्: destroyer of the pride of the lotus forest
words.प्रणमदभयदानप्रौढि: granting fearlessness to those who bow down
words.कृष्णपादाम्बुजाभ्याम्: to the lotus feet of Krishna

overall_meaning: May my mind dwell on the lotus feet of Krishna, which are the abode of the eternal pastimes of all the worlds' fortune, the destroyer of the pride of the lotus forest, highly powerful and granting fearlessness to those who bow down.

verse: नित्यानन्दसुधानिधेरधिगतः सन्नीलमेघः सता-मौत्कण्ठयप्रबलप्रभञ्जनभरैराकर्षितो वर्षति ।विज्ञानामृतमद्भुतं निजवचोधाराभिरारादिदंचेतश्चातक चेन्न वाञ्छसि मृषा क्रान्तोऽसि सुप्तोऽसि किम्

words.नित्यानन्दसुधानिधेः: of the ocean of eternal bliss

overall_meaning: The dark blue cloud of the ocean of eternal bliss, drawn by the forceful winds of the good people's eagerness, showers the wonderful nectar of knowledge through his words. O mind, like the Chataka bird, if you do not desire this, you are falsely gone and asleep.

verse: निद्राहारविहारेष्वनादरः सङगराहित्यम् ।वचने चानवकाशः कृष्णस्मरणेन शाश्वती शान्तिः
overall_meaning: Indifference to sleep, food, and activities, freedom from conflict, no time for speech, and eternal peace come by remembering Krishna.

verse: निरुद्धं वाष्पान्तः कथमपि मया गद्गदगिराह्विया सद्यो गूढा पथि विघटितो वेपथुरपि ।गिरिद्रोण्यां वेणौ ध्वनति निपुणैरिङगितनयेतथाप्यूहां चक्रे मम मनसि रागः परिजनैः
overall_meaning: Suppressing tears within and somehow calling with a choked voice, immediately hidden, trembling on the path. As the expert played the flute in the mountain cave, by the signs, my mind, with affection, guessed by the companions.

verse: नीतं यदि नवनीतं नीतं नीतं किमेतेन ।आतपतापितभूमौ माधव मा धाव मा धाव
overall_meaning: If the butter is taken, taken, taken, what is the use? O Krishna, do not run on the sun-scorched ground, do not run.

verse: पथि धावन्निह पतितो रोदिष्यम्बाकरावलम्बाय ।पतितोद्धारणसमये किन्न स्मरसि त्वमात्मानम्
overall_meaning: Running on the path, fallen here, you cry, 'Mother, hold my hand.' Do you not remember yourself while lifting the fallen?

verse: परमानन्दसन्दोहकन्दं भद्रकरं सताम् ।इन्दिरामन्दिरं वन्दे गोविन्दं नन्दनन्दनम्
overall_meaning: I bow to Govinda, the son of Nanda, the root of supreme bliss, the bringer of auspiciousness for the virtuous, the abode of Lakshmi.

verse: परमिममुपदेशमाद्रियध्वं निगमवनेषु नितान्तखेदखिन्नाः ।विचिनुत भवनेषु वल्लवीनामुपनिषदर्थमुलूखले निबद्धम्
overall_meaning: Respect this supreme advice, you who are extremely distressed in the forest of Vedas. Search in the homes of the Gopis for the meaning of the Upanishads bound in the mortar.

verse: पर्याकुलेन नयनान्तविजृम्भितेनवक्‍त्रेण कोमलदरालितविभ्रमेण ।मन्त्रेण मञ्जुलतरेण च जल्पितेननन्दस्य हन्त तनयो हृदयं धुनोति

words.नयनान्तविजृम्भितेन: glancing with the corners of the eyes

overall_meaning: Alas, Nanda's son agitates the heart with his agitated glances from the corners of his eyes, his face with delicate and enchanting movements, and his most beautiful talking.

verse: पुञ्जीभूतं प्रेम गोपाङगनानां मूर्तीभूतं भागधेयं यदूनाम् ।एकीभूतं गुप्तवित्तं श्रुतीनां श्यामीभूतं ब्रह्म मे सन्निधत्ताम्
overall_meaning: May the Brahman, which is the accumulated love of the Gopis, the embodied fortune of the Yadavas, the unified hidden wealth of the Vedas, and the darkened essence, be present to me.

verse: पुण्यतमामतिसुरसां मनोऽभिरामां हरेः कथां त्यक्‍त्वा ।श्रोतुं श्रवणद्वन्द्वं ग्राम्यं कथमादरं वहति
overall_meaning: Leaving the most virtuous, most delightful, mind-enchanting story of Hari, how can the ears bear respect for mundane stories?

verse: पुत्रान्पौत्रमथ स्त्रियोऽन्ययुवतीर्वित्तान्यथोऽन्यद्धनंभोज्यादिष्वपि तारतम्यवशतो नालं समुत्कण्ठया ।नैतादृग्यदुनायके समुदिते चेतस्यनन्ते विभौसान्द्रानन्दसुधार्णवे विहरति स्वैरं यतो निर्भयम्

words.यदुनायके: in the Lord of the Yadus
words.सान्द्रानन्दसुधार्णवे: in the ocean of concentrated bliss

overall_meaning: Sons, grandsons, women, other young women, wealth, other riches, enjoyables, etc., are not worthy of great longing according to their varying degrees. In the infinite, Supreme Lord, the Lord of the Yadus, such feelings do not arise, as the mind freely and fearlessly plays in the ocean of concentrated bliss.

verse: प्रणयपटुपिपासापीडितानद्य प्राणान्क्षणमपि कथयाहं हा कथं सान्त्वयानि ।असहनिजविकुण्ठाः कण्ठमुत्कण्ठयाप्ताननु तव मुखमिन्दुं द्रष्टुमेते त्वरन्ति

words.प्रणयपटुपिपासापीडितान्: tormented by intense thirst for affection

overall_meaning: Oh, how can I pacify these lives tormented by intense thirst for affection, even for a moment today? Intolerant of their own distress, their throats choked with longing, they hasten towards your moon-like face to see it.

verse: प्रणयपरिणताभ्यां प्राभवालम्बनाभ्यां प्रतिपदललिताभ्यां प्रत्यहं नूतनाभ्याम् ।प्रतिमुहुरधिकाभ्यां प्रस्नुवल्लोचनाभ्यां प्रभवतु हृदये नः प्राणनाथः किशोरः
overall_meaning: May our beloved lord, youthful and graceful at every step, matured in love and a support of excellence, ever new every day and increasing in charm every moment with eyes overflowing, shine in our hearts.

verse: प्रमितयदृच्छालाभे सन्तुष्टिर्दारपुत्रादौ ।ममताशून्यत्वमतो निरहङकारत्वमक्रोधः
overall_meaning: Contentment with gains received by chance, absence of possessiveness towards wife, children, etc., absence of ego, and absence of anger – these are the qualities to be cherished.

verse: प्रिय इति गोपवधूभिः शिशुरिति वृद्धैधीश इति देवैः ।नारायण इति भक्तैर्ब्रह्मेत्यग्राहि योगिभिर्देवः
overall_meaning: The god who is considered dear by the cowherd women, a child by the elders, lord by the gods, Narayana by the devotees, and Brahman by the yogis.

verse: प्रेमदं च मे कामदं च मे वेदनं च मे वैभवंच मे ।जीवनंच मे जीवितंच मे दैवतं च मे देव नापरम्
overall_meaning: You are my giver of love, fulfiller of desires, pain, prosperity, life, sustenance, and deity, O god, there is no other for me.

verse: फुल्लेन्दीवरकान्तिमिन्दुवदनं बर्हावतंसप्रियंश्रीवत्साङकमुदारकौस्तुभधरं पीताम्बरं सुन्दरम् ।गोपीनां नयनोत्पलार्चिततनुं गोगोपसङघावृतंगोविन्दं कलवेणुवादनपरं दिव्याङगभूषं भजे

words.फुल्लेन्दीवरकान्तिम्: radiant like a blooming blue lotus
words.कलवेणुवादनपरं: engaged in playing the sweet flute

overall_meaning: I worship Govinda, who is radiant like a blooming blue lotus, moon-faced, fond of wearing a peacock feather, adorned with the mark of Srivatsa and the great Kaustubha gem, dressed in yellow garments, beautiful, worshipped by the eyes of the cowherd girls like lotuses, surrounded by cows and cowherds, engaged in playing the sweet flute, and adorned with divine ornaments.

verse: बर्हं नाम विभूषणं बहु मतं वेषाय शेषैरलंवक्‍त्रं दन्तविशेषकान्तिलहरीविन्यासधन्याधरम् ।शीलैरल्पधियामगम्यविभवैः श्रृङगारभङगीमयंचित्रं चित्रमहो विचित्रमहहो चित्रं विचित्रं महः
overall_meaning: The peacock feather is indeed an ornament highly esteemed as part of His attire by others. His face is adorned with the special charm of His teeth arranged like waves, blessed are His lips. His virtues and romantic elegance are inaccessible to those with little intellect. Oh, how varied and wonderful is His splendor!

verse: बालिकातालिकाताललीलालयासंगसंदर्शितभ्रूलताविभ्रमः ।गोपिकागीतदत्तावधानः स्वयं संजगौ वेणुना देवकीनन्दनः
overall_meaning: Engaged in the rhythmic play of clapping hands with the girls, displaying graceful movements of his brows, the son of Devaki, who paid attention to the songs of the cowherd girls, himself sang along with the flute.

verse: बिभ्रद्वेणुं जठरपटयोः श्रृङगवेत्रे च कक्षेवामे पाणौ मसृणकवलं तत्फलान्यङ्‌गुलीषु ।तिष्ठन्मध्ये स्वपरिसुहृदो हासयन्नर्मभिः स्वैःस्वर्गे लोके मिषति बुभुजे यज्ञभुग्बालकेलिः
overall_meaning: Holding the flute in his waistband and the stick for driving cows under his left arm, with a soft ball of food in his left hand and its fruits in his fingers, he stood in the middle of his friends, making them laugh with his jokes. Observing this, even the gods in heaven enjoyed the receiver of offerings' (Krishna's) childish play.

verse: ब्रह्मन्नत्र पुरद्विषा सह पुरः पीठे निषीद क्षणंतूष्णीं तिष्ठ सुरेन्द्र चाटुभिरलं वारीश दूरीभव ।एते द्वारि मुहुः कथं सुरगणाः कुर्वन्ति कोलाहलंहन्त द्वारवतीपतेरवसरो नाद्यापि निष्पद्यते
overall_meaning: O Brahman, sit here for a moment with Shiva in front on the seat, stay silent, O lord of gods (Indra), enough with the flattering words, O lord of waters (Varuna), stay away. Why do these groups of gods constantly make noise at the door? Alas, even today, the opportunity to meet the lord of Dvaraka has not arisen.

verse: भक्तिस्त्वयि स्थिरतरा भगवन्यदि स्या-द्दैवेन नः फलितदिव्यकिशोरवेषे ।मुक्तिः स्वयं मुकुलिताञ्जलि सेवतेऽस्मा-न्धर्मार्थकामगतयः समयप्रतीक्षाः

words.किशोरवेषे: in the form of a young boy

overall_meaning: O Lord, if steadfast devotion to you exists in us, by fate it will bear fruit in the form of the divine young boy. Liberation herself will serve us with folded hands, and the goals of righteousness, prosperity, and desire will wait for the right time.

verse: भूतेष्वन्तर्यामी ज्ञानमयः सच्चिदानन्दः ।प्रकृतेः परः परात्मा यदुकुलतिलकः स एवायम्

words.यदुकुलतिलकः: the ornament of the Yadu dynasty

overall_meaning: He, who is the inner controller in all beings, full of knowledge, existence, consciousness, and bliss, beyond nature, the supreme self, and the ornament of the Yadu dynasty, is indeed this one.

verse: मध्येगोकुलमण्डलं प्रतिदिशं चाम्भारवोज्जृम्भितेप्रातर्दोहमहोत्सवे नवघनश्यामं रणन्नू पूरम् ।भाले बालविभूषणं कटिरनत्सत्किङकिणीमेखलंकण्ठे व्याघ्रनखं च शैशवकलाकल्याणकार्त्स्न्यं भजे
overall_meaning: I adore the one in the middle of the circle of Gokula, resounding with the booming of clouds in all directions, during the great morning milking festival, who is dark as a new cloud, with a sounding flute, adorned with child's ornaments on the forehead, a waist decorated with tinkling bells, a tiger's claw on the neck, embodying all auspicious skills of childhood.

verse: मन्दारपुष्पवासितमन्दानिलसेवितं परानन्दम् ।मन्दाकिनीयुतपदं नमत महानन्ददं महापुरुषम्
overall_meaning: Bow down to the great person, who is fragrant with mandara flowers, served by a gentle breeze, the supreme bliss, with the Ganga at his feet, the giver of great joy.

verse: माधुर्यादपि मधुरं मन्मथतातस्य किमपि कैशोरम् ।चापल्यादपि चपलं चेतो मम हरति किं कुर्मः

words.मन्मथतातस्य: of the son of the god of love

overall_meaning: The indescribable youth of the son of the god of love, sweeter than sweetness and more restless than restlessness, captivates my mind. What shall I do?

verse: मार मा वस मदीयमानसे माधवैकनिलये यदृच्छया ।हे रमारमण वार्यतामसौ कः सहेत निजवेश्मलङघनम्
overall_meaning: Oh delight of Rama (Krishna), who resides in my heart according to your wish, who can tolerate? Who can tolerate the transgression of one's own abode?

verse: मुग्धं स्निग्धं मधुरमुरलीमाधुरीधीरनादैःकारंकारंकरणविवशं गोकुलव्याकुलत्वम् ।श्यामं कामं युवजनमनोमोहनं मोहनाङंगचित्ते नित्यं निवसतु महो वल्लवीवल्लभं नः

words.मधुरमुरलीमाधुरीधीरनादैः: sweet, with the gentle sound of the flute
words.युवजनमनोमोहनं: captivator of the minds of young people

overall_meaning: May the dark complexioned, desirable one, who is innocent, tender, sweet, with the gentle sound of the flute, captivated by the sounds 'ka' and 'ra', restless like Gokula, captivator of the minds of young people, captivating the minds of everyone eternally, great beloved of the cowherd maidens, reside in our hearts.

verse: मूकं करोति वाचालं पङ्गु लङ्घयते गिरिम् ।यत्कृपा तमहं वन्दे परमानन्दमाधवम्
overall_meaning: I salute to the supreme bliss, Adhava (Krishna), whose grace makes the dumb speak and the lame cross the mountain.

verse: मृदुभाषिता प्रसादो निजनिन्दायां स्तुतौ समता ।सुखदुःखशीतलोष्णद्वन्द्वसहिष्णुत्वमापदो न भयम्
सुखदुःखशीतलोष्णद्वन्द्वसहिष्णुत्वमापदः: the state of enduring happiness, sorrow, cold, and heat
overall_meaning: With gentle words, kindness in criticism, equanimity in praise, enduring happiness, sorrow, cold, and heat, there is no fear.

verse: मृद्वीका रसिता सिता समशिता स्फीतं च पीतं पयःस्वर्यातेन सुधाप्यधायि कतिधा रम्भाधरः खण्डितः ।सत्यं ब्रूहि मदीयज
रम्भाधरः: Krishna, the stealer of the heart
overall_meaning: The milk flavored and chilled, with a foamy head, made yellowish by adding sugar slightly, and nectar in various ways, and the heart-stealer Krishna, though his heart is broken, speak the truth, my friend.

verse: यद्यपि गगनं शून्यं तथापि जलदामृतांशुरुपेण ।चातकचकोरनाम्नोर्दृढभावात्पूरयत्याशाम्
overall_meaning: Although the sky is empty, yet with a drop of water, in the form of the Chataka bird, with firm resolve, satisfies hopes.

verse: यद्यपि सर्वत्र समस्तथापि नृहरिस्तथाप्येते ।भक्ताः परमानन्दे रमन्ति सदयावलोकेन
overall_meaning: Although Krishna is everywhere and in all situations, still these devotees delight in supreme joy with loving glances.

verse: यद्वत्समलादर्शे सुचिरं भस्मादिना शुद्धे ।प्रतिफलति वक्त्रमुच्चैः शुद्धे चित्ते तथा ज्ञानम्
overall_meaning: Just as a polished mirror reflects the face very clearly with ash, when pure, so does knowledge reflect in a pure mind.

verse: यमुनापुलिने समुत्क्षिपन् नटवेषः कुसुमस्य कन्दुकम् ।न पुनः सखि लोकयिष्यते कपटाभीरकिशोरचन्द्रमाः
यमुनापुलिने: on the bank of the Yamuna
overall_meaning: On the bank of the Yamuna, throwing the guise of a dancer, the flower ball, O friend, will not again entertain, like the deceitful boyish moon.

verse: या चिन्ता भुवि पुत्रपौत्रभरणव्यापारसम्भाषणेया चिन्ता धनधान्यभोगयशसां लाभे सदा जायते ।सा चिन्ता यदि नन्दनन्दनपदद्वन्द्वारविन्दे क्षणंका चिन्ता यमराजभीमसदनद्वारप्रयाणे प्रभो

words.पुत्रपौत्रभरणव्यापारसम्भाषणेया: about the upbringing of sons and grandsons
words.धनधान्यभोगयशसां: about the enjoyment of wealth, riches, and fame
words.नन्दनन्दनपदद्वन्द्वारविन्दे: at the lotus feet of Nandanandana (Krishna)
words.यमराजभीमसदनद्वारप्रयाणे: about going through the door of the house of Yamaraja (the god of death)

overall_meaning: Anxiety about the upbringing of sons and grandsons, about the enjoyment of wealth, riches, and fame always arises. That anxiety, O Lord, if even for a moment it is at the lotus feet of Nandanandana (Krishna), what anxiety would there be about going through the door of the house of Yamaraja (the god of death), O Lord.

verse: यां दृष्ट्वा यमुनां पिपासुरनिशं व्यूहो गवाम गाहतेविद्युत्वानिति नीलकण्ठनिवहो यां द्रष्‍टुमुत्कण्ठते ।उत्तंसाय तमालपल्लवमितिच्छिन्दन्ति यां गोपिकाःकान्तिः कालियशासनस्य वपुषः सा पावनी पातु नः

words.उत्तंसाय: of the tips of the tamala trees
words.तमालपल्लवम्: the sprouts of the Tamala trees
words.कालियशासनस्य: of the command of Kaliya (the serpent)

overall_meaning: May she, who, seeing the thirsty Yamuna, incessantly forms clouds to provide shade to the cows, and having flashed thus, yearns to see whom, like the blue-throated one (Shiva), tear apart the sprouts of the tamala trees

verse: ये मुक्तावपि निःस्पृहाः प्रतिपदप्रोन्मीलदानन्ददांयामास्थाय समस्तमस्तकमणिं कुर्वन्ति यं स्वे वशे ।तान् भक्तानपि तां च भक्तिमपि तं भक्तिप्रियं श्रीहरिंवन्दे सन्ततमर्थयेऽनुदिवसं नित्यं शरण्यं भजे

words.प्रतिपदप्रोन्मीलदानन्ददांयामास्थाय: in the wave of ever-rising joy
words.समस्तमस्तकमणिं: the crest jewel of all jewels

overall_meaning: I perpetually adore and worship Sri Hari, who, though free from desires, in the wave of ever-rising joy, makes the crest jewel of all jewels, whom even the devotees and their devotion, dear to devotion, are under their control forever.

verse: रत्नाकरस्त्व गृहं गृहिणी च पद्मा किं देयमस्ति भवते जगदीश्वरायआभीरवामनयनाहृतमानसाय दत्तं मनो यदुपते कृपया गृहाण

words.रत्नाकरस्त्व: O husband of the goddess of fortune
words.जगदीश्वराय: to the Lord of the universe
words.आभीरवामनयनाहृतमानसाय: whose mind is absorbed in thoughts of Lord Vamana, whose eyes steal the mind

overall_meaning: O husband of the goddess of fortune, O wife of the householder, and Lakshmi, what is to be given to you? O Lord of the universe, please accept the mind given by the wife, whose mind is absorbed in thoughts of Lord Vamana, whose eyes steal the mind, O Lord of the Yadus, out of compassion.

verse: राधामुग्धमुखारविन्दमधुपस्त्रैलोक्यमौलिस्थली-नेपथ्योचितनीलरत्‍नमवनीभारावतारक्षमः ।स्वच्छन्दव्रजसुन्दरीजनमनस्तोषप्रदोषश्चिरंकंसध्वंसनधूमकेतुरवतु त्वां देवकीनन्दनः
overall_meaning: O Lord, the one with a face as charming as the honey-stream, adorned with the burden of the earth's gems, whose head is the appropriate abode of the blue gems, the one who protects the moon-like cowherd girls, who gives eternal pleasure to the minds of the people, and who is the eternal destroyer of sorrows, may that son of Devaki protect you.

verse: रासे चञ्चलतां गतस्य ललनावृन्दस्य मध्ये हरीराजत्येष कथं भवेदुपमितिस्तादृङ्‌ न भावो भुवि ।चेत्स्याच्चञ्चलता गता विपुलता विद्युत्सु संनर्तनंतन्मध्ये जलदस्य नर्तनमतिः शोभा भवेत्तादृशी
overall_meaning: In the dance, amidst the group of playful sportive girls, gone is the unsteadiness. How can the desires of Krishna be compared? Such emotion does not exist on earth. If the unsteadiness is gone, then the greatness is vast. The beauty of the intense dance, like the lightning's dance in the midst of the clouds, may such be the beauty.

verse: रे रे मानसभृङग मा कुरु मुधा झङकारकोलाहलंनिःशब्दं हरिपादफुल्लकमले माध्वीकमास्वादय ।तस्मिन् सर्वतृषापहारिणि चिदानन्दे मरन्दे सकृ-न्निष्पीते क्व नु ते प्रयास्यति लयंसाहङ्‌कृतिर्झङ्‌कृतिः
overall_meaning: Hey mind-bee, do not indulge in the foolish uproar of tinkling sounds. Taste the nectar of Hari's feet, akin to the silent full-blown lotus. In that, removing all thirst, delighting in the consciousness of bliss, having drunk at once, where indeed will your effort be? The melody and the tinkling sound are both dissolved.

verse: लावण्यामृतवन्यां मधुरिमलहरीपरीपाकः ।कारुण्यानां हृदये कपटकिशोरः परिस्फुरतु
overall_meaning: May the beauty, nectar of the forest, the matured wave of sweetness, and the adolescent filled with compassion blossom in the heart of deceit.

verse: लीलाटोपकटाक्षनिर्भरपरिष्वङ्गप्रसङगाधिक-प्रीते रीतिविभङगसङगरलसद्वेणुप्रणादामृते ।राधालोचनलालितस्य ललितस्मेरे मुरारेर्मुदामाधुर्यैकरसे मुखेन्दुकमले मग्नं मदीयं मनः

words.टोपकटाक्ष: glance from the corner of the eyes

overall_meaning: In the joyful violation of decorum due to excessive affection in playful activities, embraces, and close association, may the nectar of the joyful sound of the flute be, where Radha, with her eyes caressed, smiling playfully, to Krishna, in the single taste of happiness and sweetness, like the moon lotus, my mind is immersed.

verse: लीलायताभ्यां रसशीतलाभ्यांलीलारुणाभ्यां नयनाम्बुजाभ्याम् ।आलोकयेदद्‌भुतविभ्रमाभ्यांकाले कदा कारुणिकः किशोरः
overall_meaning: When will the compassionate youth, with his eyes moist with emotion, attainable with the reddish playfulness of his lotus-like eyes, cause to see the wonderful bewilderment by the sportive moments?

verse: वन्दे मुकुन्दमरविन्ददलायताक्षंकुन्देन्दुशङखदशनं शिशुगोपवेषम् ।
overall_meaning: I salute Mukunda, whose eyes are like lotus petals, with teeth like jasmine buds and the attire of a cowherd child.

verse: इन्द्रादिदेवगणवन्दितपादपीठंवृन्दावनालयमहं वसुदेवसूनुम्
overall_meaning: I am the son of Vasudeva, whose feet are worshipped by Indra and other gods, and whose abode is in Vrindavan.

verse: वलयाङ्गुलीयकाद्यानुज्ज्वलयन्तं स्वलङकारान् ।गलविलुलितवनमालं स्वतेजसापास्तकलिकालम्
overall_meaning: I salute you, who is adorned with bracelets, finger rings, and other illuminating ornaments, with a garland swinging around your neck, radiating your own light, an artistic work of your brilliance.

verse: विहाय कोदण्डशरान्मुहूर्तं गृहान पाणौ मणिचारुवेणुम् ।मायूरबर्हंच निजोत्तमाङगेसीतापते त्वां प्रणमामि पश्चात्
overall_meaning: After laying aside the bow and arrows momentarily, taking in your hands the beautifully ornamented flute, peacock feather, and your own excellent body, O husband of Sita, I bow to you afterward.

verse: विहाय पीयूषरसं मुनीश्वरा ममाङ्‌घ्रिराजीव रसं पिबन्ति किम् ।
overall_meaning: Leaving aside the nectar, what are the sages drinking if not the nectar from the lotus feet of mine?

verse: इति स्वपादाम्बुजपानकौतुकी स गोपबालः श्रियमातनोतु नः
overall_meaning: Thus astonished by drinking the nectar of his own lotus feet, may that cowherd boy bestow prosperity upon us.

verse: वृन्दारण्ये तपनतनयातीरवानीरकुञ्जेगुञ्जन्मञ्जुभ्रमरपटलीकाकलीकेलिभाजि । आभीरीणां मधुरमुरलीनादसम्मोहितानांमध्ये क्रीडन्नवतु सततं नन्दगोपालबालः

words.नन्दगोपालबालः: the young boy of Nanda, the cowherd

overall_meaning: In the forests of Vrindavan, the daughter of the burning banks, the groves resound with the sweet humming of bees, the fluttering of leaves, the cawing of crows, and the playful engagement. May the young cowherd boy of Nanda, always playing among the bewitched gopis with the sweet sound of his flute, be ever present.

verse: वृन्दावृन्दमरन्दबिन्दुनिचयस्पन्देन सन्दीपिता-द्गन्धाद्यस्य सनन्दनादिरमृतानन्देऽपि मन्दादरः । मोक्षानन्दथुनिन्दिसेवनसुखस्वाच्छन्द्यसंदोहदंतद्वन्देमहि नन्दनन्दनपदद्वन्द्वारविन्दं मुहुः

words.नन्दनन्दन: the abode of the joy of Nandana

overall_meaning: Even though his pleasure grove, beginning with the groups of trees in Vrindavan, is faintly filled with the nectar of bliss by the accumulation of the killing drops, illuminated by the vibration, and fragrant with the beginning of his pleasure. Repeatedly, we experience the dual joy, which is the bliss of liberation, definitely in the service happiness, freedom from doubt, and the greatness of that joy, the lotus-like abode of the joy of Nandana

verse: व्यामोहप्रशमौषधं मुनिमनोवृत्तिप्रवृत्त्यौषधंदैत्येन्द्रार्तिकरौषधं त्रिभुवने सञ्जीवनैकौषधम् ।भक्त्यात्यन्तहितौषधं भवभयप्रध्वंसनैकौषधंश्रेयःप्राप्तिकरौषधं पिब मनः श्रीकृष्णदिव्यौषधम्

words.मुनिमनोवृत्तिप्रवृत्त्यौषधं: medicine for the conduct and behavior of sages
words.दैत्येन्द्रार्तिकरौषधं: medicine alleviating the distress of the king of demons
words.सञ्जीवनैकौषधम्: the one medicine that revives all
words.भक्त्यात्यन्तहितौषधं: medicine beneficial beyond measure through devotion
words.भवभयप्रध्वंसनैकौषधं: medicine that destroys the fear of worldly existence
words.श्रेयःप्राप्तिकरौषधं: medicine that brings about ultimate welfare

overall_meaning: This divine medicine serves as a remedy for dispelling delusion, for the conduct and behavior of sages, alleviating the distress of the king of demons in the three worlds, and it revives all. It is a medicine beneficial beyond measure through devotion, destroying the fear of worldly existence, bringing about ultimate welfare. O mind, drink this divine medicine of Shri Krishna.

verse: शत्रुच्छेदैकमन्त्रं सकलमुपनिषद्वाक्यसम्पूज्यमन्त्रंसंसारोच्छेदमन्त्रं समुचिततमसः सङ्घनिर्वाणमन्त्रम् ।सर्वैश्वर्यैकमन्त्रं व्यसनभुजगसंदष्टसंत्राणमन्त्रंजिह्वे श्रीकृष्णमन्त्रं जप जप सततं जन्मसाफल्यमन्त्रम्

words.शत्रुच्छेदैकमन्त्रं: the mantra for the destruction of enemies
words.सकलमुपनिषद्वाक्यसम्पूज्यमन्त्रं: the mantra revered by all statements of Upanishads
words.संसारोच्छेदमन्त्रं: the mantra for the cessation of worldly existence
words.सङ्घनिर्वाणमन्त्रम्: the mantra for the ultimate liberation from bondage
words.सर्वैश्वर्यैकमन्त्रं: the one mantra for all kinds of sovereignty
words.व्यसनभुजगसंदष्टसंत्राणमन्त्रं: the mantra for the relief from the grip of the serpent of addiction
words.जन्मसाफल्यमन्त्रम्: the mantra for the fruition of life

overall_meaning: This is the mantra for the destruction of enemies, revered by all statements of Upanishads, for the cessation of worldly existence, removing the deepest darkness, the mantra for the ultimate liberation from bondage. It's the one mantra for all kinds of sovereignty, for the relief from the grip of the serpent of addiction. O tongue, chant the mantra of Shri Krishna constantly, the mantra for the fruition of life.

verse: शरीरं सुरुपं ततो वै कलत्रं यशश्वारु चित्रं धनं मेरुतुल्यम् ।यशोदाकिशोरे मनो वै न लग्नं ततः किं ततः किं ततः किं ततः किम्न भोगे न योगे न वा वाजिराजौ न कान्तामुखे नैव वित्तेषु चित्तम्यशोदाकिशोरे मनो वै न लग्नं ततः किं ततः किं ततः किंततःकिम्षडङगादिवेदो मुखे शास्त्रविद्या कवित्वादि गद्यं सुपद्यं करोति ।यशोदाकिशोरे मनो वै न लग्नं ततः किंततः किं ततः किंततः किम्रे चित्त चिन्तय चिरं चरणौ मुरारेःपारं गमिष्यसि यतो भवसागरस्य ।पुत्राः कलत्रमितरे न हि ते सहायाःसर्वं विलोकय सखे मृगतृष्णिकाभम्

words.यशोदाकिशोरे: in Krishna, the son of Yashoda
words.वाजिराजौ: in the king of beasts (elephant) or in the king of humans
words.कान्तामुखे: in the face of a beloved
words.यशोदाकिशोरे: in Krishna, the son of Yashoda
words.किंततःकिम्षडङगादिवेदो: what, then, what, what, what, what, the Vedas, the branches of knowledge
words.यशोदाकिशोरे: in Krishna, the son of Yashoda
words.मुरारेः: of Krishna, the enemy of Mura
words.मृगतृष्णिकाभम्: like the mirage of a deer

overall_meaning: The body is beautiful, then indeed the wife, fame, and long life are splendid, wealth majestic as Mount Meru. In Krishna, the son of Yashoda, the mind is not attached. Then what? Then what? Then what? Then what? What, then, is the mind not attached to? Not in enjoyment, not in yoga, or in the king of beasts (elephant) or in the king of humans, nor in the face of a beloved, certainly not in riches. In Krishna, the son of Yashoda, the mind is not attached. Then what? Then what? Then what? Then what? What, then, the Vedas, the branches of knowledge, on the face, knowledge of scriptures, poetry, etc., eloquent prose, does in Krishna, the son of Yashoda, the mind is not attached. Then what? What, then, what? What, then, what? What, then, what, in me? Meditate for a long time at the feet of Krishna, the enemy of Mura, you will go across, from where, the ocean of existence. Sons, wife, and friends, indeed, your helpers, seeing everything, O friend, are like the mirage of a deer.

verse: श्रवसोः कुवलयमक्ष्णोरञ्जनमुरसो महेन्द्रमणिदाम ।वृन्दावनरमणीनां मण्डनमखिलं हरिर्जयति

words.कुवलयमक्ष्णोरञ्जनमुरसो: ointment for the eyes of the ears
words.महेन्द्रमणिदाम: the gift of the king of mountains (Meru)
words.वृन्दावनरमणीनां: of the enjoyers of Vrindavan's pleasures

overall_meaning: Krishna, the giver of the gift of the king of mountains (Meru), the ointment for the eyes of the ears, conquers all adornment of the enjoyers of Vrindavan's pleasures.

verse: श्रियः कान्ताः कान्तः परमपुरुषः कल्पतरवोद्रुमो भूमिश्चिन्तामणिगणमयी तोयममृतम्‌ ।कथा गानं नाटयं गमनमपि वंशी प्रियसखीचिदानन्दं ज्योतिः परमपि तदास्वाद्यमपि च

words.भूमिश्चिन्तामणिगणमयी: the earth composed of desire-fulfilling gems

overall_meaning: The Supreme Person is the most attractive of beauties, the wish-fulfilling tree of attractiveness. He is the earth composed of desire-fulfilling gems and the nectar of water. His stories, music, dancing, and walking are the flute. His beloved companion is pure bliss. He is the supreme light, even its taste.

verse: श्रीकृष्ण श्याम राधाधव यदुनृपते यामुनप्रान्तचारिन्‌वृन्दारण्यैकवासिन्मधुरशशिमुख स्निग्धमूर्ते व्रजेश ।वंशीवाद्योचित स्त्रग्भरपरिमलयुक्‌पिच्छसङ्‌क्रान्तचूडप्रत्यङगश्रीनिवास प्रदिश मनसि मे स्वीयभक्तिप्रकाशम्‌

words.यामुनप्रान्तचारिन्‌: wanderer at the banks of the Yamuna
words.वृन्दारण्यैकवासिन्: dweller in the forests of Vrindavan
words.स्त्रग्भरपरिमलयुक्‌: adorned with the fragrance of flowers
words.पिच्छसङ्‌क्रान्तचूडप्रत्यङगश्रीनिवास: residence of the beauty that adorns the peacock feather and the entire body
words.स्वीयभक्तिप्रकाशम्‌: the manifestation of my own devotion

overall_meaning: O Shri Krishna, dark and the lover of Radha, the king of the Yadus, who wanders at the banks of the Yamuna, and dwells in the forests of Vrindavan. With a sweet moon-like face and a charming form, O Lord of Vraja, fitting for the flute's music, adorned with the fragrance of flowers, residence of the beauty that adorns the peacock feather and the entire body, in my mind, the manifestation of my own devotion.

verse: श्रीकृष्णनामा जयतीह शश्वत् कश्चित्स सच्चिन्मयनीलिमा मे ।यत्रानुरक्तं धवलत्वमेति स्थैर्यंच चित्तं मलिनं चलं च
overall_meaning: The name of Shri Krishna always triumphs forever. Some perceive it as the blue hue of existence. Where the mind is attached, considered as paleness, there is steadfastness, and the mind is both tainted and fickle.

verse: श्रीकृष्णस्य मनोज्ञनादमुरलीं विम्बाधरं श्रीमुखंसम्पूर्णाकृतिमच्छशाङकललितं हृत्कौस्तुभाध्यासितम्‌ ।पादौ नूपुरमञ्जुशिञ्जितनमत्कैवल्यनिन्दाक्षम-स्वादौ तप्तसुवर्णकान्ति वसनं साक्षात्करिष्ये कदा

words.विम्बाधरं: with lips resembling the bimba fruit
words.हृत्कौस्तुभाध्यासितम्‌: adorned with the Kaustubha gem in the heart

overall_meaning: I will experience the garment of Shri Krishna, which has a charming flute, lips resembling the bimba fruit, an auspicious face, a complete form, beautifully adorned with a peacock feather, and adorned with the Kaustubha gem in the heart. His feet are adorned with charming anklets, insulting the glory of liberation. When will I experience the flavor of His radiance, which is like molten gold?

verse: श्रृण्वञ्जनार्दनकथागुणकीर्तनानिदेहे न यस्य पुलकोद्‌गमरोमराजिः ।नोत्पद्यते नयनयोर्विमलाम्बुमालाधिक् तस्य जीवितमहो पुरुषाधमस्य

words.श्रृण्वञ्जनार्दनकथागुणकीर्तनानि: listening to stories and glorifying the qualities
words.पुलकोद्‌गमरोमराजिः: the king of hair standing on end
words.नयनयोर्विमलाम्बुमालाधिक्: more than a clear lotus for the eyes

overall_meaning: For the wretched person, life is a great misery, where the king of hair standing on end is not aroused by listening to stories and glorifying the qualities in the body, more than a clear lotus for the eyes.

verse: सजलजलदकालं प्रेमवापीमराल-मभिनववनमालं क्षेमवल्लीप्रवालम् ।भुवननलिननालं दानवानां करालंनिखिलमनुजपालं नौमि तंनन्दबालम्
overall_meaning: I bow down to that child of Nanda, who is surrounded by fresh forests filled with water, flourishing vines, cooling the universe, fearsome to demons, and protects all mankind with love.

verse: सत्यं ब्रवीमि मनुजाः स्वयमूर्ध्वबाहु-र्यो मां मुकुन्द नरसिंह जर्नादेनेति ।

words.स्वयमूर्ध्वबाहु-र्यो: He who has his arms raised

overall_meaning: Truly I say, O Mukunda, O Narasimha, he who has his arms raised to me with his nails.

verse: जीवो जपत्यनुदिनं मरणे रणे वापाषाणकाष्ठसदृशाय ददाम्यभीष्टम्

words.वापाषाणकाष्ठसदृशाय: similar to a blade of grass

overall_meaning: While living, repeating every day, in death, in battle, similar to a blade of grass, I give the desired boon.

verse: सत्यं समस्तजन्तुषु कृष्णस्यावस्थितेर्ज्ञानम् ।अद्रोहो भूतगणे ततस्तु भुतानुकम्पा स्यात्
overall_meaning: Let there be truth in all creatures, knowledge situated in Krishna, non-deception among all beings, and may there arise compassion for beings.

verse: समाश्रिता ये पदपल्लवप्लवं महत्पदं पुण्ययशो मुरारेः ।भवाम्बुधिर्वत्सपदं परं पदं पदं पदं यद्विपदां न तेषाम्

words.पदपल्लवप्लवं: the flood of the lotus feet
words.भवाम्बुधिर्वत्सपदं: like a calf to the ocean of existence

overall_meaning: For those who take refuge in the flood of the lotus feet, the great abode, the fame of the virtuous Murari (Krishna), that supreme abode, which is like a calf to the ocean of existence, is not for those who are different.

verse: साक्षाद्यथैकदेशे वर्तुलमुपलभ्यते रवेर्विम्बम् ।विश्‍वं प्रकाशयति तत्सर्वैः सर्वत्र दृश्यते युगपत्
overall_meaning: Just as in one place, the circular form of the sun is perceived, the universe illuminates and is seen everywhere simultaneously by all.

verse: सान्द्रानन्दपुरन्दरादिदिविषद्‌वृन्दैरमन्दादरा-दानम्रैर्मुकुटेन्द्रनीलमणिभिः सन्दर्शितेन्दीवरम्‌ ।स्वच्छन्दं मकरन्दसुन्दरगलन्मन्दाकिनी मेदुरंश्रीगोविन्दपदारविन्दमशुभस्यन्दाय वन्दामहे

words.सान्द्रानन्दपुरन्दरादि: With clusters of dense happiness like the God of love and others
words.दिविषद्‌वृन्दैरमन्दादरा-दानम्रैर्मुकुटेन: with gentle respect, with the best of blue jewels on the crown
words.मकरन्दसुन्दरगलन्मन्दाकिनी: The delightful stream of honey from the Makaranda flower
words.श्रीगोविन्दपदारविन्दम्: the lotus feet of Lord Govinda

overall_meaning: We adore the lotus feet of Lord Govinda, which are spontaneously revealed, with clusters of dense happiness like the God of love and others, with gentle respect, with the best of blue jewels on the crown, with the delightful stream of honey from the Makaranda flower to dispel misfortune.

verse: सिन्धुर्बिन्दुमहो प्रयच्छति न हि स्वैरी च धाराधरःसङकल्पेन विना ददाति न कदाप्यल्पश्च कल्पद्रुमः ।

words.सिन्धुर्बिन्दुमहो: The moon (sindhu) gives (prayacchati) the great (maha) drop (bindu)

overall_meaning: The moon gives the great drop, indeed not independently, and the holder of the stream (river) gives without imagination, not at any time, a wish-fulfilling tree.

verse: स्वच्छन्दोऽपि विधुः सुधावितरणे रात्रिन्दिवापेक्षतेदाता कोऽपि न दृश्यते विनियमं श्रीकृष्णचन्द्रं विना

words.रात्रिन्दिवापेक्षते: does not distinguish between night and day
words.श्रीकृष्णचन्द्रं: without the moon of Sri Krishna

overall_meaning: Even spontaneously, the moon in the distribution of nectar does not distinguish between night and day; no one is seen to have such restriction without the moon of Sri Krishna.

verse: सुतरामनन्यशरणाः क्षीराद्याहारमन्तरा यद्वत् ।केवलया स्नेहदृशा कच्छपतनयाः प्रजीवन्ति

words.सुतरामनन्यशरणाः: Those who have taken sole refuge in Ram, the son of Dasaratha
words.क्षीराद्याहारमन्तरा: with a diet of milk and other

overall_meaning: Just as those who have taken sole refuge in Ram, the son of Dasaratha, live with a diet of milk and other, just like the sons of the tortoise, with affection.

verse: सुरभीकृतदिग्वलयं सुरभिशतैरावृतं सदा परितः ।सुरभीतिक्षपणमहासुरभीमं यादवं नमत

words.सुरभीकृतदिग्वलयं: The ocean made fragrant in all directions
words.सुरभीतिक्षपणमहासुरभीमं: The one who gives immense fragrance to those who are capable of smelling

overall_meaning: I bow to Yadava, the one who gives immense fragrance to those who are capable of smelling, the ocean made fragrant in all directions, surrounded by hundreds of fragrances, always all around.

verse: स्थूला सूक्ष्मा चेति द्वेधा हरिभक्तिरुद्दिष्टा ।प्रारम्भे स्थूला स्यात्सूक्ष्मा तस्याः सकाशाच्च
overall_meaning: Devotion to Hari is designated as two-fold, gross and subtle. At the beginning, it is gross; gradually, it becomes subtle.

verse: स्मितविकसितवक्‍त्रं रत्नपाणौ सुवेणुंसुललितमणिहारं वारिजास्यं वदान्यम् ।तरुणजलदनीलं चारुगोविन्दवृन्दैःपरमपुरुषमाद्यं बालकृष्णं नमामि

words.स्मितविकसितवक्‍त्रं: With a smiling and blossoming face
words.सुवेणुंसुललितमणिहारं: wearing a charming necklace of pearls
words.तरुणजलदनीलं: with a complexion resembling young rain clouds
words.चारुगोविन्दवृन्दैःपरमपुरुषमाद्यं: the primeval person, adorned by the beautiful group of cowherds headed by Govinda

overall_meaning: I bow to young Krishna, with a smiling and blossoming face, with hands adorned with jewels, wearing a charming necklace of pearls, clad in yellow garments, speaking eloquently, with a complexion resembling young rain clouds, the primeval person, adorned by the beautiful group of cowherds headed by Govinda.

verse: स्मृतिसत्पुराणवाक्यैर्यथाश्रुतायां हरेर्मूर्तौ ।मानसपूजाभ्यासो विजननिवासेऽपितात्पर्यम्

words.स्मृतिसत्पुराणवाक्यैर्यथाश्रुतायां: In accordance with the words of the Smritis and Puranas as heard
words.हरेर्मूर्तौ: in the form of Hari (Lord Vishnu)
words.विजननिवासेऽपितात्पर्यम्: Understanding the essence even while living in the world

overall_meaning: Mental worship practice, in accordance with the words of the Smritis and Puranas as heard, in the form of Hari (Lord Vishnu), understanding the essence even while living in the world.

verse: स्वाश्रमधर्माचरणं कृष्णप्रतिमार्चनोत्सवो नित्यम् ।विविधोपचारकरणैर्हरिदासैः सङगमः शश्वत्

words.स्वाश्रमधर्माचरणं: Observing one's own duty (dharma) in the stage of life
words.कृष्णप्रतिमार्चनोत्सवो: The festival of worshiping Krishna's idol
words.विविधोपचारकरणैर्हरिदासैः: by the various rituals performed by the servants of Hari (devotees)

overall_meaning: Observing one's own duty (dharma) in the stage of life, the festival of worshiping Krishna's idol daily, by the various rituals performed by the servants of Hari (devotees), association with them is eternal.

verse: हस्तमुत्क्षिप्य यातोऽसि बलात् कृष्ण किमद्भुतम् ।हृदयाद्यपि निर्यासि पौरुषं गणयामि ते
overall_meaning: O Krishna, having thrown away the weapon, you have gone forcefully. What a wonder! Even from the heart, you have withdrawn the courage. I count your bravery.

verse: हे कृष्ण कृष्ण भगवन् मम चित्तभृङगोयायात् कदापि भवतश्चरणारविन्दे ।देहादिपुष्पविरतः कृपया तदानींवीक्षस्व वामनयनेन निजं पदाब्जम्

words.भवतश्चरणारविन्दे: at the lotus feet of yourself

overall_meaning: Oh Krishna, Krishna, Lord, Oh bee of my mind, ever at the lotus feet of yourself. Devoid of bodily desires, out of kindness, now please look upon your own lotus feet with your left eye.

verse: हे गोपालक हे कृपाजलनिधे हे सिन्धुकन्यापतेहे कंसान्तक हे गजेन्द्रकरुणापारीण हे माधव ।हे रामानुज हे जगत्त्रयगुरो हे पुण्डरीकाक्ष मांहे गोपीजननाथ पालय परं जानामि न त्वां विना

words.सिन्धुकन्यापतेहे: O Lord of the daughter of the ocean (Lakshmi)
words.गजेन्द्रकरुणापारीण: O Ocean of Elephant-like Compassion (to Gajendra)
words.जगत्त्रयगुरो: O Preceptor of the Three Worlds

overall_meaning: Oh protector of the cowherds, O ocean of compassion, O Lord of the daughter of the ocean (Lakshmi), O Slayer of Kamsa, O Ocean of Elephant-like Compassion (to Gajendra), O Madhava, O Ramanuja, O Preceptor of the Three Worlds, O Lotus-eyed one, protect me. I know no supreme refuge without you, O Lord of the gopis.

verse: हे देव हे दयित हे भुवनैकबन्धोहे कृष्ण हे चपल हे करुणैकसिन्धो ।हे नाथ हे रमण हे नयनाभिरामहा हा कदानु भवितासि पदं दृशोर्मे
overall_meaning: Oh God, Oh Beloved, Oh friend of the universe, Oh Krishna, Oh restless one, Oh ocean of mercy, Oh Lord, Oh delight, Oh charming to the eyes, Alas! When will you become the abode of my sight?

verse: हे लोकाः श्रृणुत प्रसूतिमरणव्याधेश्चिकित्सामिमांयोगज्ञाः समुदाहरन्ति मुनयो यां याज्ञवल्क्यादयः ।अन्तर्ज्योतिरमेयमेकममृतं कृष्णाख्यमापीयतांतत्पीतं परमौषधं वितनुते निर्वाणमात्यन्तिकम्

words.प्रसूतिमरणव्याधेश्चिकित्सामिमां: the remedy for birth, death, and disease
words.योगज्ञाः: wise in the knowledge of yoga

overall_meaning: Oh people, listen! The wise sages, knowledgeable in the science of yoga, explain the remedy for birth, death, and disease, starting from Yajnavalkya. Distribute the ultimate medicine, known as Krishna, drink that immeasurable, eternal inner light, which is the ultimate liberation.
